meanings.sent1: After dropping off the package, I had to recarry it to the correct address.
meanings.sent2: She had to recarry the groceries from the car to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful courier had to recarry the lost package multiple times.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to recarry a hidden meaning that intrigued her.
meanings.sent5: The image of the weary traveler recarrying his heavy bag stuck in her mind.

meanings.sent1: The ant had to recarry the food crumb to its nest.
meanings.sent2: The mother bird would recarry twigs to build her nest.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy squirrel had to recarry the acorn after dropping it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to recarry a sense of warmth and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The diligent worker would recarry the heavy load without complaint.

meanings.definition: To bring back or carry back.
meanings.sent1: He promised to recarry the borrowed book to the library.
meanings.sent2: The dog would recarry the ball every time it was thrown.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to recarry the rabbit after it escaped from the hat.
meanings.sent4: The melody seemed to recarry her thoughts to a distant memory.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the flowers would recarry her to her childhood garden.
